main event: A moving and flickering lighted object was reported in the vicinity of the Big Dipper constellation near Springfield, Pennsylvania on May 6, 1957.
interesting points: The object was described as moving erratically.
The initial report came from a Mr. Otto, who contacted Olmstead Air Force Base to report the sighting.
The Air Force's 4602nd Air Intelligence Service Squadron was tasked with contacting the civilian observer to obtain more information.
A follow-up telephone contact was made with the civilian observer, Mr. [name redacted], on May 17, 1957.
The report indicates that an ATIC Form 164 was sent to the civilian observer with instructions to return it to the Air Force.
sighted object: a moving and flickering lighted object
photographs: yes, the report indicates photographs were taken
